trans-unit.source: Represents a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid"></xref> column that hosts <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox"></xref> controls in its cells.
Use <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridCheckBoxColumn> to display columns of Boolean data as a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox>.
The following illustration shows an example of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridCheckBoxColumn>.
![A DataGridCheckBox column](~/add/media/wpf-datagrid-checkbox.png "A DataGridCheckBox column")
To populate the column, bind the column to the data by using the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridBoundColumn.Binding%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridBoundColumn.Binding%2A> property is applied to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox> element created in the column.
The <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.DataContext%2A> for the element in each cell is the data item for the row the cell is in.
Therefore, to set up the binding you only have to set the <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.Path%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Optionally, you can specify a <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.Converter%2A?displayProperty=fullName> if your data source and target are different types.
For more information about data binding, see [Data Binding (WPF)](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-binding-wpf.md).

You can customize the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridCheckBoxColumn> by setting properties, such as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridColumn.Width%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridColumn.Header%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridCheckBoxColumn.IsThreeState%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridColumn.IsReadOnly%2A>.
If you want to display other types of data, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid> provides the following column types:
Column Type
Data Display
Use to display URI data.
Use to display enumeration data.
Use to display text.
If you want to use other controls in your <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid>, you can create your own column types by using <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridTemplateColumn>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridCheckBoxColumn"></xref> class.
Gets the default value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridBoundColumn.EditingElementStyle"></xref> property.
An object that represents the style.
Gets the default value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridBoundColumn.ElementStyle"></xref> property.
An object that represents the style.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox"></xref> control that is bound to the column's <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridBoundColumn.Binding"></xref> property value.
The cell that will contain the generated element.
The data item represented by the row that contains the intended cell.
A new check box control that is bound to the column's <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridBoundColumn.Binding"></xref> property value.
Gets a read-only <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox"></xref> control that is bound to the column's <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridBoundColumn.Binding"></xref> property value.
The cell that will contain the generated element.
The data item represented by the row that contains the intended cell.
A new, read-only check box control that is bound to the column's <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridBoundColumn.Binding"></xref> property value.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the hosted <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox"></xref> controls enable three states or two.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridCheckBoxColumn.IsThreeState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property lets you use a nullable Boolean as the data type and has the same functionality as the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.IsThreeState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property on <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox>.

The three states for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton.IsChecked%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox> control are `true`, `false`, and `null`.
`true` if the hosted controls support three states; `false` if they support two states.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGridCheckBoxColumn.IsThreeState"></xref> dependency property.
Called when a cell in the column enters editing mode.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid> control calls the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridColumn.PrepareCellForEdit%2A> method when a cell in a column derived from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridColumn> enters editing mode.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridCheckBoxColumn> class overrides this method to respond immediately to the user gesture by updating the value in the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox> control.

This immediate response is necessary because a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridCheckBoxColumn> cell enters edit mode with the same user gesture that changes the state of its hosted <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox>.
The element that the column displays for a cell in editing mode.
Information about the user gesture that is causing a cell to enter editing mode.
The unedited value.
Refreshes the contents of a cell in the column in response to a column property value change.
The cell to update.
The name of the column property that has changed.
